page.title: 10Sports in Haltwhistle
page.content: Bowls have been played in Haltwhistle for over 100 years. The members take turns in looking after the green and the club house. Elderly players can often be seen sitting on the benches in the sun watching. Next door are two hard tennis courts with free access as the key has been lost. Players have to provide their own racket and ball. In the summer there is an over 16 five-a-side football league which meets on the school field. This years winners were Lambo's Loonys. The Haltwhistle fishing bailiffs hold a fishing competition each year. They take competitors by car to a spot by the river and after three hours fishing the angler with the heaviest fish wins. First prize is a fishing rod, second a reel and third a line.
